page.title: 01LANDSCAPE SCRAPTOFT THURNBY
page.content: Our grid measuring 4x3 km. lies on the eastern boundary of the city of Leicester and stretches from the villages of Scraptoft and Thurnby in the west to Houghton on the Hill in the east. The area to be surveyed is the valley of the Thurnby brook which lies between two ridges to the north and south of the stream. The brook rises near New Ingarsby and flows to the city centre where it joins the River Soar. The villages Scraptoft, Thurnby and Houghton on the Hill lie in the NW,SW, and SE corners of the grid and the abandoned village of Ingarsby lies just outside NE corner. Scraptoft and Ingarsby villages are mentioned in the original Domesday Book, a copy of which can be found in the church.
